title: Silicon Validation Software Engineer- GPU IP Validation and Integration
summary: Do you love creating elegant solutions to highly complex challenges? ... enable our customers to do all the things they love with their devices!
description: You will be writing shaders that stress the GPU and cause high bandwidth traffic to and from the memory subsystem. ... perform system level validation.
key_qualifications:
We would prefer that you have the following skills:
- Experienced with Graphics, OpenGL, and CUDA
- Understanding of the GPU pipeline and graphics theory
- Understanding of system and SoC architectures
- Experienced with image processing, memory hierarchies, and compilers
- Strong C/C++ programming skills
- Implement and run ML/LLM workloads for GPU characterization
- Proficient in Python and GNU Make
- Deep understanding of compute systems, operating systems, and computer architecture
- Passionate about writing code close to the hardware, and debugging.
- In-depth knowledge and experience in SoC system level validation and debugging of SoC software and hardware issues.
- You enjoy the validation mentality: meticulous, curious, and persistent.
education_experience: A minimum of a BS degree and a minimum of 10 years of relevant industry experience in silicon validation software engineering or related field.
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $175,800 and $312,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location....
